column5: What kinda chuck wagon contraption lol..awesome engineering Terry..love the garage builds ..looks like fun
you know your a redneck when..........lol...j/k.....looks great...best of luck!!
Wow, very Cool Terry.   Paul is on call this weekend, but you can bet we'll be out there next Sunday.  PM me if you want to go
Don't you have a sled?  Lol
LOL Joeytier... it would have been easier for him to put wheels on his sled skis.. YES!

That is awesome!  I really like the width of the tracks - more grip & better traction.  Very good ideas here.  Fabricating skis that go around the wheels is an awesome idea - in case you accidentally engage 4 wheel drive.  Last year I investigated the tracks for ATVs (the type that wrap around the original 4 wheels) - they were about $4,000.00, then you also need a big engine to drive them.  I was advised a 500cc might be a little small.
I saw tracks on an Outlander 500 earlier this year, and it performed quite well in deep snow, but 4 grand buys you a very nice snow machine!
Right on Joey!  That's why I don't own a set of trax.  Terry's set up is something I'm going to give a lot of serious thought to.
What was the bottom line on this project, Terry? It will be awesome on the lakes, but maybe not in tight trails.  S.

It is as wide as some Polaris atvs  Bottom line. Price?  I have. 2200.00. Into it  A big expense is you have to buy smaller tires so when you add the track they are the same hight as the front. Then you need the 2 followi tires for the ever back.
Easily removable in case of breakdown? Blowing a track etc?
Terry, that's pretty awesome!

You could still run it if one of the tracks blew Really the only thing that could slow you down would be a wrecked track or tire.   And you would be able to travel slow with this. Unlike a regular Atv or skidoo.  You blow a track or tire on them and you are done  I have 40 mins of running it so I can't answer all the questions
Every time you drive up highway 11, they still have that one on the post way up in the air.  Too bad they went out of business.
Yup  It is too bad
Just sitting there it is cool.
Awesome , some thought and time went into that for sure, have fun with it.
One wicked looking ride!    to you and Brian!
Ohhh you gotta be fnkiddinme!  That's gnarly dood!  Job well engineered and done Terry.
it's been a long time getting everything I need  to build it got the last part today and put it together after work and took her out for a spin
Nice work Terry. Looks like it will go through anything. Is this a kit or did you make it from scratch?
Very cool!  Is that a kit or a home made invention? Put a video up if you get a chance.  edit- IFH beat me to it
I got most of the  parts from  hitch a track , they are out of business but had some parts  Brian made a bunch of parts for me
Very impressive Terry, looks like that thing will go just about anywhere.
Nice work.  I assume that you started with a two wheel drive machine?  If it was four wheel drive those skis on the front may not work quire as well as you hope.
Where is the ductape red green??  Looks awesome
I can switch from 2 to 4 wheel drive, so the skis will work just fine Wayne came up with a way to have the skis built around the wheels , so it will be able to be in 4 wheel drive, ..a summer project
MUD FLAPS!! It needs mud flaps!.. well snow flaps..
oh yeah it does
That is SLICK!!
Looks intresting lets go back laking
Sweet rig! Look forward to some video!
We'll get some for you G when he's stuck between two trees!!!
Pretty cool setup!
I will be making it 4" narrower , but not in time for the trip
4 inches shouldn't make any difference on our normal portages.. not sure you'd get up to Brown's with that though.
kewl
LMAO!
The ingenuity of the folks on this site is phenomenal. What a nice set up. Dragons Den boys? I'll do the Bull ing, you do the builds.
it's 8 " wider then most skidoos what yea think am I going to get stuck between 2 trees
I don't know...you know the tightness of some trails. I'm just thinking before skis were the wide part and the narrow end followed. You're the other way around...
you want me to go in reverse lol
We could video that too !!
That's wicked!!
